reviewText: Live from Royal Albert Hall (cd/dvd) by The Killers is more than a concert, it is an experience! I was so impressed with this live concert from one of my favorite bands of the 21st Century. Brandon Flowers has never sounded better and wow he sings each song with such passion, I am so happy I purchased this item. My favorite performances include: For Reasons Unknown, This is Your Life, Losing Touch, Read My Mind, Jenny Was a Friend of Mine, Bling (Confession of a King), and All These Things That I've Done. The audio and picture quality are excellent and there are some great bonus features on the DVD, interviews with fans and crew. The audio cd is pretty good, the best sounding song on the cd is Spaceman. I highly recommend this "killer" purchase!!

reviewText: The Killers Live from Royal Albert Hall is pure rocking from start to finish. No fanciful sets or costume changes but Brandon Flowers and band mates are full of energy and the setlist is extremely tight, alternating between their big hits and eclectic tracks. Rock to Human, Somebody Told Me, Mr. Brightside, When You Were Young, Smile Like You Mean It and much more. At the end of it, you will find yourself exhausted, jumping and singing along with them, right in the comfort of your home.The disc itself plays hi-def quality crystal clear on your HDTV and the sound is impeccable as you blast it through the speakers. And I must say whoever designed the interactive menu has created one of the best and most appealing navigation experience ever on a blu ray disc. Would have wished that they included all their videos to date as extras. Still, this is nothing less than the best! A+
Title: N/A

reviewText: I eagerly bought this CD/DVD of The Killers playing live at the Royal Albert Hall and I was sorely disappointed. The music and performance are good, but the sound is terrible. The CD sounds like it was a bootleg recording, all the instruments sound extremely dull. Only Brandon Flower's singing makes it through the speakers sounding somewhat clearly but everything else is washed out. I don't know what they did to produce such a poor album soundwise but it's a shame and not worth the money I paid for this.The DVD sounds slightly better than the CD, but again I don't think audiophiles will be too impressed by the qiality here either.

reviewText: Soy un calcetinero desatado de The Killers gracias a mi amigo personal, los he ido a ver las 2 veces que han estado tocando en Chile y no podia perderme la oportunidad de recordar y revicir esos grandiosos momentos con un dvd de lujo de la gira Day & Age.Sobrepaso totalmente mis expectativas este dvd. Es un concierto espectacular, extraordinario y circumbirumbico.La calidad de los extras es genial, los videos de Hyde Park y el Behiend the scenes son buenisimos.En fin, un concierto y un dvd que entra sin asco a mi top 10 de conciertos.Se demoro 32 dias en llegar a mi humilde morada en Temuco - Chile, pero valio la pena la espera.Soy una victima mas de The Killers...

reviewText: I heard the song "Human" and couldn't get enough of it. So, I researched this band and decided to get this DVD to experience a live concert. The quality is unsurpassed, in picture and sound. I thought the days of the real band died with Britney Spears and the pop - manufactured music of today. I'm so glad I was wrong. The Killers are amazing musicians and showmen. Wow. By the time the concert was over, I was exhausted. It was an experience, even just from my tv screen. Highly recommended.

reviewText: After a friend heard some of my music tastes, I was given the "You're not a Killers fan???" so I made it a mission to pick up one of their CDs the next time I was at the store. I found the CD/DVD combo of the Royal Albert Hall performances and was instantly sold. The only problem I have now is which CD to listen to since I picked up the other four and Mr. Flowers' solo work the following day! Massively talented band and incredible performers, loved the energy and diversity of their set list, anticipate that they'll be a permanent fixture in my music collection from now on.

reviewText: Don't let Brandon Flowers' boyish good looks fool you.While he may look like your check out clerk where you buy groceries,or the nice young fellow that lives in the apartment upstairs,he's actually the front man for one of the greatest live acts you will ever see.From the first notes of "Human" The Killers put on a fast pace,in your face assault on eyes,ears,chest cavity (if you have a sub woofer)that doesn't let up until the final encore.Both vocals and musicianship are top notch and is easily one of the best CD/DVD combos on the market for the money.It is loaded with extras as well.To keep an audience on their feet singing word for word on every song,sometimes even louder than the band is pretty impressive.One minor flaw is not all the tracks on the DVD are on the CD,in this case "Sweet Talk" which is one of the best cuts on the video are absent from the audio disc,other than that I promise you even if your not a fan of this band,this album WILL CHANGE YOUR MIND.Yes it is that good!Highlights-"Read My Mind",Jenny Was a Friend of Mine","Spaceman" to name a few.If you are a fan of live performance what are you waiting for?This is for you!NOTE-One detail I did notice is how little interaction there is (or isn't) between the band members on and off stage,maybe it was time to take a break from each other,who knows?
summary: The Killers live up to their name!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I watched this via Palladia through Comcast's HD Music channel.  I have always enjoyed The Killers and their music, but I never would have considered myself of real fan of them until I saw this show.I was watching it on my 54" plasma one random night (the show was an hour long on TV) and I couldn't turn the channel after hearing one song (a song I had previously not heard).  Turns out, I was right at the beginning of the show and proceeded to watch the remaining 50+ mins without changing the channel.The colors, the energy, the atmosphere, and the band's amazing sound make this a must-have for my Blu-ray collection.  I caught the tail-end of this performance again the other night on Comcast, and I was still amazed by the performance for just those few minutes.  Royal Albert Hall in London looks like the perfect place to watch a concert, and it was the perfect place to host The Killers and the show they put on that night.I can't wait to have this in Blu-ray and see what the 2-hour show looks like.

reviewText: this is an amazing blu ray.the killers deliver on every note (no pun intended).brandon flowers and the rest of the band have an amazing stage presence and they are definitely gonna go down with the likes of the beatles,rolling stones etc....they have picked some great songs to perform although i do wish they played neon tiger,everything will be alright,tidal wave,four winds,a crippling blow and perhaps an acoustic version of read my mind but its still awesome all the same.the blu ray quality is crisp and the colours are lush and truly bring the gig alive right to your home.keep it up guys...you clearly have this gift of making great music.cant wait for the next LP.brandon flowers is the most graceful and talented musician out there.what melodies these chaps come up with.two thumbs up all the way !!!

reviewText: I am one of the guys that said when "Day and Age" was released that the album hadn't been that good in my humble opinion and that they had ended sounding like a pop band a la The Cure back in the 80's with their "Kiss me, kiss me, kiss me" record. So, I wasn't expecting much from this live record and to be honest The killers wasn't exactly the band I was hoping to see in live shows eventhough I knew I was going to buy the album. For my surprise I was wrong about the band playing live. They really made a great show, the guitarist really knows how to play his tunes as well as the bass player and the drummer (pardon my ignorance if I don't know the guys names). On the other hand, Brandon Flowers knows how to connect with the audience and he does sing pretty damn good (yeah, he might go off key every now and then and maybe he gasps for air too but who wouldn't?).Something tha was obvious for me is that The killers playing live try to reach the heights of bands like U2 or The Cure and that's not something bad at all. They want to be greater and bigger in every song and they want to let the audience know that. I didn't really like the whole "Day and Age" album released last year (maybe with the exception of the singles but not Spaceman... I still have a problem with that song... but I like much more the live version here) but for sure this live recording was pretty damn good to the point that the band has caught my attention again. Before I leave I must say that the "Shadowplay" cover from Joy Division is superb!!!! If a band... any band!... comes up with a cover of Joy Division... this band must be heard by everyone.
summary: This time I take my hat off for The Killers
Title: N/A

reviewText: There is no other way to say it:  The Killers Live at Royal Albert Hall is the best live performance DVD of the decade.  Being the best American band this decade has produced the Killers prove once and for all they earned that coveted title.  Playing in front of an excited and loyal british crowd in London makes the DVD all the more exciting.  Brandon Flowers is in perfect voice and commands the stage in all his glory.  Mark and Dave will astonish you with their playing and Ronnie is one of the most exciting drummers in the world to watch.  They play all the songs you want to hear and is equally distributed from their three platnium albums.  I cannot say enough for this DVD.  It just floored me.  5 star rating, it is a must have for any rock fan.  And what a low price!  It is has both the DVD and the CD.  A wonderful gift from this band.  Thank you boys.  You did your fans proud.
summary: THE BEST LIVE DVD OF THIS DECADE
Title: N/A

reviewText: POSITIVE:  Nearly everything.  This is one of my favorite concert DVD's.  Every song is really really great.  It's upbeat, it's interesting, it's energetic, the musicianship is really excellent, the hall is awesome, the audience enthusiastic.  Despite some little niggles, below, this is a "if you like the Killers, definitely get this" kinda deal.The filming is excellent, if a bit too frenetic at times.  It does capture the excitement and the great lighting well.  It'd be nice to focus on one musician for longer periods, especially when they're doing cool stuff.  I liked the theme of the camera moving into the hall, and following the band, and then leaving at the end.  The bit following the lead out into the hall (and lowering the sound) and then to the balcony was a nice touch.MINOR GRIPE: My only real critical comment is about sound quality....where did the cymbals go?  You can barely hear them in the mix and the drummer is amazing, so we're missing some really cool stuff.  I tried playing this on my friend's system (same problem), checked that my system was working, all channels, because literally, the cymbals are mostly lost.  You can hear them from a distance, especially when nothing else is playing, but there is no direct sound.  All the subtle stuff you can see him doing is barely audible.  This is a huge loss as the whole concert would be richer with these percussive details.  How did they miss this in the sound room?In general the sound is OK, but not the DVD's strong point.  I've heard much better mixes on DVD's where you can hear each instrument distinctly, the singer's voices are clear and strong, and the sense of space is captured.  If there's one place for the producers to improve on, it's the sound quality.  (Bluray doesn't fix that, of course, because if it's not recorded well, the format won't fix it.).OK, end of gripe section- the concert is awesome  and the DVD is still totally worth it!
summary: fabulous concert, sound ok, totally worth it
Title: N/A

reviewText: I already have the blu-ray and I enjoyed it so much that I had to get the CD/DVD package, just to get the CD.To my ears, in comparison to the DVD, the CD mix mainly amplifies and highlights Brandon Flowers' wonderful vocals.  The CD has some different sounding instruments and sound effects too.  The CD is mixed just different enough from the video to stand on it own merits.As to the video, I wholeheartedly agree with all the other reviewers who rave on how great this concert is.  Being "live" really elevates this concert to another level.  The venue location, the production values and the song list are excellent.  The vocals, the musicians, and the fan enthusiasm really make this concert shine.Specifically, Brandon Flowers really out-performs himself, to the point of exhaustion.  In addition, I must point out that Mr. Flowers is so polite and well-mannered.

reviewText: The Killers are so much more than the radio would lead you to believe. Where I live they think the only Killers song to ever exist is "Somebody Told Me". I bought this only knowing the songs from Hot Fuss and Sam's Town but loved every second of this show. This is one of the best concert DVDs I've seen and I am now determined to see The Killers live at some point.I bought the set that included the CD because it was cheaper. The box turned out to be one of those cursed digipaks but at least it has plastic holders for the discs. If you only know a few of The Killers songs but you like what you've heard, consider buying this wonderful concert. You may be pleasantly surprised.
summary: Amazing Show From An Amazing Band ~

reviewText: Let me start out by saying first off that I like my music! More so, I like a great live performance! This concert ranks right up there with some of the best I have seen. Many bands can make a good studio album. And the studio can make a good band sound better than they really are. I have spent lots of money over the years going to live concerts. Sometimes to find out that a band we thought was sure to give a good performance, was actually a snoozer. What a let down! I only own a few DVD concert videos-all of these include great live bands. This was my first Blu-Ray concert video purchase and I was blown away. All facets of this video were done close to perfection. I will name a few reasons why: The venue, the camera angles, lighting, special effects, set, fan interaction/participation, and most of all THE BAND! The sound was incredible!I have always liked the Killers music, but never realized how diverse it was. Never even owned one of their albums before buying this concert footage. What turned me on to it was the fact that I heard "When you were young" on the radio. No, it wasn't the first time I'd heard the song, but it was the live version from the Royal Albert Hall concert. It sounded great live, and you could sort of feel the energy of the live show. After the song, I took note of where the live show was played at... Long story short, after checking out a short preview clip from another unnamed music store I found myself on Amazon looking to secure a Blu-Ray copy before the release! Glad I did. I have watched it 3 times with different people and they too were all wowed by the overall performance. All had the same comments-couldn't believe how good they really were. Sound even better live!I recommend anyone to get this concert if you are on the fence. You won't be disappointed! If you have 1080 HD capabilities and a good sound system, go for the Blu-Ray!-T
Title: N/A
